_header: Thou art solace in all our woe
_description: James Ryman, a hymn to Christ — three quatrains (abab) including refrain, ‘Thou art welcum with us to dwell’ and burden: ‘O rex noster emanuel / Thou art welcum with us to dwell’

CULEe112.First Lines:
Thou art solace in alle oure wooAnd thou art oure confort as
                    welle…
CULEe112.Last Lines:
…Therfore we sey bothe man and childeThou arte welcum with us
                    to dwelle
CULEe112.Note: Not attributed to Ryman in the MS.
CULEe112.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius,
